text:
HTTPD 2.0 don't load a different charset by default one.

The default charset loading lines are in httpd.conf.

The pages includes the default META headers:
<meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=iso-8859-2">

Old Apache 1.3 correctly diplays the iso-8859-2 but the new one httpd 2.0 no.

Thanks,
NetCat.it
creator: info@netcat.it
nd@perlig.de
text:
Apache doesn't read your pages. This is clearly a configuration error, so please
ask in a user support forum for this.

Thanks for using Apache.

creator: info@netcat.it
text:
Apache read my pages:

http://www.kraskipust.org/slo/index.html

but doesn't read the headers...

Ok, he reads them in order to deliver them, but he doesn't *interpret* them. You
need to configure which charset the HTTP header (not HTML header) should send
(Look into the mod_mime docs).
creator: nd@perlig.de

text:
httpd.conf is already configured for charsets and header as default configuration:

AddCharset ISO-8859-1  .iso8859-1  .latin1

AddCharset ISO-8859-3  .iso8859-3  .latin3
AddCharset ISO-8859-4  .iso8859-4  .latin4
